newsitem.title: JAPAN: March JGB futures end up on short-covering.
newsitem.headline: March JGB futures end up on short-covering.

text.p: The March Japanese government bond (JGB) futures contract ended Monday's Tokyo session higher on dealers' short-covering.
The March closed up 0.44 at 125.82, after rising as high as 125.94 shortly before the close.
Short-covering gained momentum in the afternoon as Tokyo stocks extended gains, traders said.

"Those players who had anticipated the market to test lower today decided to cover short positions in the afternoon. However, investors' activities were not detected in the cash market," a brokerage house trader said.
